meanings.definition: Failure to observe or pay attention to something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant inobservances during class led to poor grades.
meanings.sent2: The inobservances of the students during the fire drill were concerning.
meanings.sent3: The inobservances of the squirrel as it missed the acorn were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The inobservances of the detective almost cost him the case.
meanings.sent5: The inobservances of the chef resulted in a burnt dinner.

meanings.definition: Lack of adherence to rules or customs.
meanings.sent1: The inobservances of the driver led to a traffic violation.
meanings.sent2: The inobservances of the team regarding the dress code were noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The inobservances of the cat with the 'keep off the grass' sign were comical.
meanings.sent4: The inobservances of the rebellious teenager were like a flagrant disregard for authority.
meanings.sent5: The inobservances of the employee resulted in a warning from the supervisor.
